definition: letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
eye/small hole/crux (of a matter)/CL:隻|只[zhi1],雙|双[shuang1]/classifier for big hollow things (wells, stoves, pots etc)
to be fastidious about phrasing, diction, or choice of words
erhua variant of 摳字眼|抠字眼[kou1 zi4 yan3]

sentences.english: I had no idea in what terms one shouted at koalas, but I did my best.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道別人用什麼字眼來叫，不過，我盡力而爲啦。

sentences.english: A message from %1 was dropped, because it contained a blacklisted word.
sentences.chinese: 送來的訊息已被丟棄，因爲包含被擋掉的字眼。

sentences.english: I have read a sentence in an essay:Even Yangjia are put to death, please don't use any contumelious words on him.
sentences.chinese: 即使楊佳被判死刑，也不許用侮辱性的字眼。

sentences.english: The car horn is like a lovely word defiled. It was never meant to be profane.
sentences.chinese: 汽車的喇叭聲是個被誤解的可愛字眼。
幸福，華麗卻又悲傷德字眼。

sentences.english: The most perplexing word in the declaration is equality.
sentences.chinese: “平等”是獨立宣言中最爲棘手的字眼。

sentences.english: They will keep you from the adulteress , from the wayward wife with her seductive words .
sentences.chinese: 他們將隨時向你從奸，從任性的妻子與她的誘人字眼。

sentences.english: The English landscape and climate was well suited to this expression.
sentences.chinese: 英語地形和氣候非常適合這個字眼。

sentences.english: She groped for the right word.
Meanwhile, the word slept in it's cage, shedding only silent tears.
sentences.chinese: 這個時候，小字眼還在囚籠裏默默地流淚。

sentences.english: The term "regime" is a familiar one.
But an equally apt name would be the “Great Stabilisation”.
sentences.chinese: 但是一個同樣合適的字眼是“大穩定”。

sentences.english: It was free to shed it's cocoon of anger and fear and sadness.
sentences.chinese: 小字眼自由地蛻去了憤怒，恐懼和悲傷的繭。

sentences.english: Anger repressed can poison a relationship as surely as the cruelest words.
sentences.chinese: 被壓抑的憤怒確實會像最殘酷的字眼一樣毒害關係。

sentences.english: However he agreed to add "KBE" after his name .
sentences.chinese: 但他願在名字後面加上KBE字眼。

definition: word (general term including monosyllables through to short phrases)/term (e.g. technical term)/expression
variant of 詞彙|词汇[ci2 hui4]
word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
meaning/implication/flavor/overtone/to mean/to imply/(Tw) to get a sense of
